( 1 ) “abridged prospectus” means a memorandum containing such salient features of a prospectus as may be specified by the Securities and Exchange Board by making regulations in this behalf;

act_summary: This section of the Companies Act 2013 defines what constitutes an abridged prospectus, which must include key features specified by the Securities and Exchange Board. It applies to all companies seeking to raise capital through securities offerings and requires adherence to specific regulations for the memorandum's content.
